channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: One Fire, One System: Hong Kong’s Fire Tragedy and the City That No Longer Exists
item.description: Hong Kong did not simply mishandle a tragedy; it demonstrated, once again, that it has become something fundamentally different from what it once was.

item.title: DOJ says Loudoun school transgender policy violated Christian students' rights
item.description: The Trump administration sued Loudoun County public schools on Monday, accusing the Virginia system of forcing its concept of "gender identity" on stu...

item.title: Right to Repair Would Help Consumers and Address ‘Affordability’
item.description: The battle over the right to repair represents a clear dividing line between supporters of certain business interests and backers of a free market.

item.title: There Is No Such Thing as an Independent Agency
item.description: The Supreme Court should overrule a 1935 precedent and put presidents back in charge of executing the law.

item.title: The Danger of Weight-Loss Drugs Going Mainstream
item.description: GLP-1s could help turn around America’s obesity epidemic. They could also bring about a new era of eating disorders for young women.

item.title: Boasberg calls DOJ whistleblower to testify as he considers contempt charge against Trump officials
item.description: U.S. District Judge James Boasberg demanded the Justice Department send one of its key lawyers to testify in person about why the government made thre...

item.title: Another Year, Another Failed Advent Calendar, And Proof That Waiting Is Hard
item.description: The only path to peace is to trust God, who is strong enough to carry the weight of all the world on his reliable shoulders.

item.title: Justice Jackson Downplays Unelected ‘Experts’ Running The Executive Without Presidential Oversight
item.description: Jackson also fearmongered about 'having a president come in and fire all the scientists, and the doctors, and the economists, and the Ph.D.s, and repl...

item.title: If You Care About The Future Of College Football, Cheer For Texas Tech In The Playoff
item.description: Texas Tech’s 2025 team turned the blue blood college football hierarchy on its head. That’s a feat worth celebrating.

item.title: The Ops Against Pete Hegseth Are Designed To Further A Color Revolution
item.description: The attacks on Pete Hegseth are not just the usual insanity, but a progression of the left's color revolution.

item.title: Faceless followers, foreign 'fake-speech networks' boost Nick Fuentes' social media reach: study
item.description: The social-media rise of pro-Hitler provocateur Nick Fuentes has alarmed conservatives, but there may be less to his audience than meets the eye.

item.title: Trump's attacks on Minnesota's Somali community cast a spotlight on fraud cases
item.description: President Donald Trump has linked his administration's immigration crackdown against Minnesota's large Somali community to a series of fraud cases inv...

item.title: Democratic Rep. Jasmine Crockett kicks off Texas Senate bid, seeking John Cornyn's seat
item.description: Texas Rep. Jasmine Crockett announced her Senate bid Monday at a Dallas campaign event -- significantly reshaping the state's Democratic primary race.

item.title: Ben Rhodes Keeps Getting It Wildly Wrong on Israel and Gaza
item.description: Setting the record straight on the recent New York Times screed by Obama’s deputy national security adviser.

item.title: Senator Who Helped Write Birthright Citizenship Clause Specifically Said It Doesn’t Include Aliens
item.description: The modern claim that the 14th Amendment guarantees automatic citizenship to the children of people who break into the country would have been unimagi...
